CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW ( “ the CCrP ” ) provided at the time that the parties should be informed of the date , time and place of an appeal hearing and that the court had to decide whether the defendant ’s presence was necessary . A convicted defendant , who was in detention and who had asked for his personal participation in the appeal hearing , was to be allowed to do so by way of personal presence in the courtroom or by way of a video link . A party ’s failure to appear before the appeal court was not to halt the appeal proceedings .
